articles.author: Mike Stone, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The decision is a major change in U.S. policy and comes as Donald Trump, who has promised to limit further support for Ukraine, prepares to take office.
articles.title: Biden allows Ukraine to use US arms to strike inside Russia

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: As losses mount and exhaustion sets in, both sides in the war are trying to replace humans with machines.
articles.title: How 1,000 days of conflict evolved into robot war between Russia and Ukraine

articles.author: Lisandra Paraguassu, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Leaders of the Group of 20 major economies were set to meet on Monday in Brazil for their annual summit, bracing for a shift in the global order with the return to power of U.S. president-elect Donald Trump.
articles.title: G20 summit confronts a global order unsettled by Trump's return

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military said it conducted strikes on "terrorist targets" in Beit Lahiya.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 14 Palestinians in Gaza, some in attacks on tents, say medics

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake reappointed Harini Amarasuriya as the prime minister of the Indian Ocean island nation on Monday.
articles.title: Sri Lanka reappoints Amarasuriya as prime minister

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ten people, including two children, were killed and 52 were injured on Sunday night when a Russian missile hit a residential nine-storey building in Ukraine's northeastern region of Sumy, Ukraine's emergency services and military said.
articles.title: Two children among 10 killed in Russian missile strike on Sumy, Ukraine says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Muhammad Awad and his family are among dozens who escaped Sudan's Tuti island earlier this year amid a siege by the Rapid Support Forces, finding refuge at a shelter after surviving for months on scant food and the risk of disease.
articles.title: Sudanese who escaped from war-torn Tuti island speak of hunger, disease

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa said on Monday lives should not be put at risk in a standoff between police and hundreds of illegal miners stuck underground in a disused mine shaft and the miners should be recovered safely.
articles.title: South Africa's Ramaphosa calls for safe recovery of illegal miners stuck underground

articles.author: Karen Lema
articles.description: The Philippines and the United States signed a military intelligence-sharing deal on Monday, deepening defence ties between the two nations facing common security challenges in the region.
articles.title: Philippines, United States sign military intelligence-sharing deal

articles.author: Andy Sullivan
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump has said he might install his picks for top administration posts without first winning approval in the U.S. Senate. This would erode the power of Congress and remove a significant check on his authority as president.
articles.title: How Trump could use recess appointments to install cabinet picks
